entry.title: Combined summary - New lower policy limits for unconfirmed transaction chains or packages
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core has lowered its policy limits for related unconfirmed transactions that will be accepted in the mempool and relayed. The decision was made after a thorough review and has been incorporated into the master branch of Bitcoin Core for 0.12 release, with the actual limits merged in PR 6771. The new limits include 25 unconfirmed ancestors, 25 unconfirmed descendants, 101kb total size with unconfirmed ancestors, and 101kb total size with unconfirmed descendants. These limits are just policy and do not affect consensus. It is important to note that these limits can be modified by command line arguments. Further discussions can be found through links in the email.
